trans-unit.source: It is important to realize that there are two ways to configure an Availability Group listener in Azure.
trans-unit.target: It is important to realize that there are two ways to configure an Availability Group listener in Azure.

trans-unit.source: These methods differ in the type of Azure load balancer you use when you create the listener.
trans-unit.target: These methods differ in the type of Azure load balancer you use when you create the listener.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the differences:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the differences:

trans-unit.source: Uses the **public Virtual IP address** of the cloud service that hosts the Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Uses the **public Virtual IP address** of the cloud service that hosts the Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: You need to access the listener from outside the virtual network, including from the internet.
trans-unit.target: You need to access the listener from outside the virtual network, including from the internet.

trans-unit.source: Uses **Internal Load Balancing (ILB)** with a private address for the listener.
trans-unit.target: Uses **Internal Load Balancing (ILB)** with a private address for the listener.

trans-unit.source: You only access the listener from within the same virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You only access the listener from within the same virtual network.

trans-unit.source: This includes site-to-site VPN in hybrid scenarios.
trans-unit.target: This includes site-to-site VPN in hybrid scenarios.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For a listener using the cloud service's public VIP (external load balancer), any data returned through the listener is considered egress and charged at normal data transfer rates in Azure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For a listener using the cloud service's public VIP (external load balancer), any data returned through the listener is considered egress and charged at normal data transfer rates in Azure.

trans-unit.source: This is true even if the client is located in the same virtual network and datacenter as the listener and databases.
trans-unit.target: This is true even if the client is located in the same virtual network and datacenter as the listener and databases.

trans-unit.source: This is not the case with a listener using ILB.
trans-unit.target: This is not the case with a listener using ILB.

trans-unit.source: ILB can only be configured on virtual networks with a regional scope.
trans-unit.target: ILB can only be configured on virtual networks with a regional scope.

trans-unit.source: Existing virtual networks that have been configured for an affinity group cannot use ILB.
trans-unit.target: Existing virtual networks that have been configured for an affinity group cannot use ILB.
